title: lz4 v1.8.1 compilation fails on centos6
body:
Summary

installation of lz4 (defaulting to latest version 1.8.1) fails on centos6 although it works on centos7. installation of the previous version 1.7.5 works on centos6.

### Expected Result
spack install -j1 lz4 installs
### Actual Result
install fails on centos6 for version 1.8.1
````console
==> Executing phase: 'install'
==> 'make' '-j128'
make[1]: Entering directory `/var/tmp/sbulut/spack-stage/spack-stage-UTGHYg/lz4-1.8.1.2/lib'
compiling static library
compiling dynamic library 1.8.1
creating versioned links
make[1]: Leaving directory `/var/tmp/sbulut/spack-stage/spack-stage-UTGHYg/lz4-1.8.1.2/lib'
make[1]: Entering directory `/var/tmp/sbulut/spack-stage/spack-stage-UTGHYg/lz4-1.8.1.2/programs'
/gsc/software/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/gcc -O3   -I../lib -DXXH_NAMESPACE=LZ4_  -c -o bench.o bench.c
/gsc/software/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/gcc -O3   -I../lib -DXXH_NAMESPACE=LZ4_  -c -o datagen.o datagen.c
/gsc/software/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/gcc -O3   -I../lib -DXXH_NAMESPACE=LZ4_  -c -o lz4cli.o lz4cli.c
/gsc/software/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/gcc -O3   -I../lib -DXXH_NAMESPACE=LZ4_  -c -o lz4io.o lz4io.c
/gsc/software/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/gcc -O3   -I../lib -DXXH_NAMESPACE=LZ4_  ../lib/lz4.o ../lib/lz4frame.o ../lib/lz4hc.o ../lib/xxhash.o bench.o datagen.o lz4cli.o lz4io.o -o lz4
bench.o: In function `BMK_benchMem':
bench.c:(.text+0x317): undefined reference to `clock_gettime'
bench.c:(.text+0x423): undefined reference to `clock_gettime'
bench.c:(.text+0x4d7): undefined reference to `clock_gettime'
bench.c:(.text+0x586): undefined reference to `clock_gettime'
bench.c:(.text+0x5ce): undefined reference to `clock_gettime'
bench.o:bench.c:(.text+0x636): more undefined references to `clock_gettime' follow
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
make[1]: *** [lz4] Error 1
make[1]: Leaving directory `/var/tmp/sbulut/spack-stage/spack-stage-UTGHYg/lz4-1.8.1.2/programs'
make: *** [lz4-release] Error 2
````

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install lz4
```

### Information on your system

centos6
gcc7.2 (spack)
